chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Call now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?
items.plainText: Call now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?

items.text: For wrath killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the silly one.
items.plainText: For wrath killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the silly one.

items.text: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.
items.plainText: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.

items.text: His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.
items.plainText: His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.

items.text: Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.
items.plainText: Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.

items.text: Although affliction cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;
items.plainText: Although affliction cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;

items.text: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.
items.plainText: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

items.text: I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:
items.plainText: I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:

items.text: Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:
items.plainText: Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:

items.text: Who giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields:
items.plainText: Who giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields:

items.text: To set up on high those that be low; that those which mourn may be exalted to safety.
items.plainText: To set up on high those that be low; that those which mourn may be exalted to safety.

items.text: He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.
items.plainText: He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.

items.text: He taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.
items.plainText: He taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.

items.text: They meet with darkness in the daytime, and grope in the noonday as in the night.
items.plainText: They meet with darkness in the daytime, and grope in the noonday as in the night.

items.text: But he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.
items.plainText: But he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.

items.text: So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.
items.plainText: So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.

items.text: Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:
items.plainText: Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:

items.text: For he maketh sore, and bindeth up: he woundeth, and his hands make whole.
items.plainText: For he maketh sore, and bindeth up: he woundeth, and his hands make whole.

items.text: He shall deliver thee in six troubles: yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.
items.plainText: He shall deliver thee in six troubles: yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.

items.text: In famine he shall redeem thee from death: and in war from the power of the sword.
items.plainText: In famine he shall redeem thee from death: and in war from the power of the sword.

items.text: Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue: neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.
items.plainText: Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue: neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.

items.text: At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
items.plainText: At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.

items.text: For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field: and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.
items.plainText: For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field: and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.

items.text: And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle shall be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.
items.plainText: And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle shall be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.

items.text: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.
items.plainText: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.

items.text: Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age, like as a shock of corn cometh in in his season.
items.plainText: Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age, like as a shock of corn cometh in in his season.

items.text: Lo this, we have searched it, so it is; hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
items.plainText: Lo this, we have searched it, so it is; hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
